Package org.microbean.type

Class TypeSemantics

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.type.TypeSemantics
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CovariantTypeSemantics, InvariantTypeSemantics
    @Experimental
public abstract class TypeSemantics
extends Object
    An object representing Type compatibility and assignability semantics.

    Subclasses that do not override anything essentially return false for all assignability tests and are rarely appropriate for much.

    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    isAssignable(Type, Type), CovariantTypeSemantics, InvariantTypeSemantics

      boolean isAssignable​(Type receiverType, Type payloadType)
      Returns true if an object bearing a Type equal to the supplied payloadType can be assigned to an object reference bearing a Type equal to the supplied receiverType, according to the semantics represented by the return value of an invocation of the getSemanticsFor(Type, Type) method with the given parameter values.

      • TypeSemantics

        Parameters:
        box - whether or not Types will be boxed before testing their assignability
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • box

        protected final Class<?> box​(Class<?> c)
        Returns a boxed representation of the supplied Class if isBoxing() returns true or the supplied Class if it does not.
        Parameters:
        c - the Class to box, maybe; may be null in which case null will be returned
        Returns:
        the result of the boxing operation, or null
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent and deterministic.
        Nullability:
        This method may return null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • isBoxing

        public final boolean isBoxing()
        Returns true if the box(Class) method will actually attempt a boxing operation in appropriate circumstances, or false if it will simply return the supplied Class.
        Returns:
        true if the box(Class) method will actually attempt a boxing operation in appropriate circumstances, or false if it will simply return the supplied Class
        See Also:
        TypeSemantics(boolean)

      • getSemanticsFor

        protected TypeSemantics getSemanticsFor​(Type receiverType,
                                        Type payloadType)
        Returns the TypeSemantics instance to use when testing if objects bearing the supplied payloadType are assignable to references bearing the supplied receiverType.

        This implementation simply returns this, which is almost always the correct thing to do.

        Overrides are prohibited from calling the isAssignable(Type, Type) method from within an invocation of this method or undefined behavior may result.

        Parameters:
        receiverType - a Type borne by a reference for which an object bearing the supplied payloadType is destined; may be null
        payloadType - a Type borne by an object destined for a reference bearing the supplied receiverType; may be null
        Returns:
        an appropriate TypeSemantics for testing the assignment semantics, or null (or this) if this TypeSemantics should be used (by far the most common state of affairs)
        Idempotency:
        This method is and its overrides must be idempotent. No guarantee is made about determinism.
        Nullability:
        This method does not but its overrides may return null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is and its overrides must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • anyIsAssignable

        public final boolean anyIsAssignable​(Type receiverType,
                                     Collection<? extends Type> payloadTypes)
        Returns true if an object bearing any of the Types contained by the supplied payloadTypes Collection is assignable to an object reference bearing a Type equal to the supplied receiverType.
        Parameters:
        receiverType - the Type borne by an object reference for which an object bearing a Type contained by the supplied payloadTypes Collection is destined; may be null in which case false will be returned
        payloadTypes - a Collection of Types possibly borne by an object destined for a reference bearing a Type equal to the supplied receiverType; may be null in which case false will be returned
        Returns:
        true if an object bearing any of the Types contained by the supplied payloadTypes Collection is assignable to an object reference bearing a Type equal to the supplied receiverType; false in all other cases
        See Also:
        isAssignable(Type, Type)
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent. Because the getSemanticsFor(Type, Type) method may be overridden, and because therefore its behavior cannot be predicted, no guarantees are made regarding determinism.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • isAssignable

        public final boolean isAssignable​(Type receiverType,
                                  Type payloadType)
        Returns true if an object bearing a Type equal to the supplied payloadType can be assigned to an object reference bearing a Type equal to the supplied receiverType, according to the semantics represented by the return value of an invocation of the getSemanticsFor(Type, Type) method with the given parameter values.
        Parameters:
        receiverType - a Type borne by a reference for which an object bearing the supplied payloadType is destined; may be null
        payloadType - a Type borne by an object destined for a reference bearing the supplied receiverType; may be null
        Returns:
        true if an object bearing a Type equal to the supplied payloadType can be assigned to an object reference bearing a Type equal to the supplied receiverType, according to the semantics represented by the return value of an invocation of the getSemanticsFor(Type, Type) method with the given parameter values; false in all other cases
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent. Because the getSemanticsFor(Type, Type) method may be overridden, and because therefore its behavior cannot be predicted, no guarantees are made regarding determinism.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
